result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee M. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Submit to AODA assessment and follow all recommendations including those of the agent.

Follow all rules of probation.

Pay costs of supervision.

Pay court costs for Count 1 only.  The Court waived costs on Counts 2 and 3.  The Court also waives the DNA surcharges for all counts.

21 days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Counts 1, 2, and 3 are concurrent with one another with 77 days credit. Jail start is stayed until on or before 5 p.m. on April 17, 2018. Release to be allowed for work and/or treatment. Costs from the original JOC have been converted to a civil judgment owed by the Defendant to the Clerk of Court.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lee M. Wilson appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty  appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Lee M. Wilson. Atty McDougal states def was seeking a longer stay on her report date. State objects to a further stay but will not object to a stay so def can can provide medical records. Court will grant stay until Tuesday, April 17th by 5pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 13, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

15CF15/sentencing after revocation and plea/sentencing in 18CM50. Defendant Lee M. Wilson in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Counsel inform the Court of the parties' agreement for resolution of these matters calling for 6 months jail with up-to 10-day stay in 15CF15 and probation in 18CM50, consecutive to the jail sentence in 15CF15. 

15CF15: Sentence - 6 months county jail. Count 2, 6 months concurrent. Count 3, 30 days, concurrent. All counts with release for work and/or treatment. Jail stayed until on or before 5 p.m. on April 9, 2018. 77 days credit.

In 18CM50, Def pleads no contest as charged. Court's colloquy on plea. Finding of guilty. Counsel and Def address the Court. Sentence: withheld for probation, 1 year. Conditions: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming ordered by the agent. Costs waived. Probation is consecutive to jail time in 15CF15.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 29, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Suzanne Edwards in court with Defendant Lee M. Wilson who is in custody. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Agent T. Salisbury appears telephonically. Comment by DA and Atty Edwards. Comment by Mr. Salisbury re. program attendance.  DA requests adjournment of this hearing til Monday, 9/28.  Atty. E - Def objects to adjournment.  Motion of P/P denied by the Court.  No further hearing set.
Hearing at 09-25-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Lee M. Wilson appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where she is in custody. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Supervising agent T Salisburg appears by telephone for DOC.  Court set this hearing for clarification re the requests that the def and DOC are making.  DA states that def has made a request re credit and ability to attend treatment; also, DOC has requested a hearing re conditional time - an amendment to the JOC - asking for 60 days additional conditional time.  Court notes that the docs he received did not include any stipulations.  Agent TS addresses the Court.  Def addresses the Court.  DA asks for motion to be held in abeyance; wants opportunity to investigate/follow up on information stated during this hearing re def's program attendance.  Court adjourns this matter to 10:45 on 9/25.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
from LW to court
Request for Amended JOC. Set for hearing. Denied-not signed

Defendant Lee M. Wilson in custody in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Today's hearing was scheduled, at defense' request, as a hearing re bond (bail bond review).  However, DA Harper states parties have reached joint resolution; recites plea agreement. Court's colloquy re. plea waiver. Ct 1 and 2 are amended to misd. bail jump per 946.49(1)(a). Def pleads NC to counts 1 & 2, NC to count 3. Further colloquy. Court finds factual basis, accepts NC pleas and finds def is entering plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently and finds def guilty on all three charges. State has 30 days to submit the amount def owes for towing of vehicle. 21 days credit in event of revocation. 

Sentencing: Ct 1 : withhold sentence, probation for 2 years: conditions: AODA assessment and recommendations- of agent, follow rules of probation, pay costs of action and costs of probation. 21 days of credit in event of revocation. Costs on one count only. No DNA.

ct 2: withhold sentence, probation for 2 years: conditions: AODA assessment and recommendations- of agent, follow rules of probation, pay costs of action and costs of probation. 21 days of credit in event of revocation. Costs on one count only. No DNA.

Ct 3: withhold sentence, probation for 2 years: conditions: AODA assessment and recommendations- of agent, follow rules of probation, pay costs of action and costs of probation. 21 days of credit in event of revocation. Costs on one count only. No DNA.
Bail/Bond Review at 03-13-2015 10:00 am
Atty. McDougal has requested a bail modification hearing be set for Friday, March 13 at 10; no objection from the DA's office
def's letter to the Court - request for modification of bail hearing ASAP; clerk forwards this letter to counsel including defense counsel Atty. McDougal

Cash bond converted to a $5000 signature bond as long as Defendant is accompanied by her sister, HW, and is traveling directly to Tellurian in Monona from the Richland County Jail or traveling from Tellurian to the Richland County Jail or participating in the inpatient drug treatment program at Tellurian.  Transport to Dane County Court from Tellurian is an exception.  Defendant must sign appropriate release at Tellurian within 6 hours of admission into the inpatient program that would allow law enforcement to determine if she was physically present in the facility.
Adjourned initial appearance at 04-22-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Lee M. Wilson in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M asks for modification of bond - cash to signature with conditions that relate to treatment; sister states she can transport to T.  DA addresses the Court -  asks that def's bond be converted to a 5k signature bond as long as she is accompanied by her sister, HW, and is traveling directly to Tellurian in Monona from the Richland County Jail or traveling from Tellurian to the Richland County Jail or participating in the inpatient drug treatment program at Tellurian.  Transport to Dane County Court from Tellurian is an exception.  Defendant must sign appropriate release at Tellurian w/in 6 hours of admission into the inpatient program that would allow law enforcement to determine if she was physically present in the facility.  

Court so orders with the specific language as stated by the DA.

Adj. initial set for 4/22 at 11.  Prelim time limits waived.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.
